website_summaries.verdict: This backpacking chair offers an unparalleled combination of style, comfort, and value.
pros: Ergonomic seat makes it simple to sit comfortably for an extended period of time
Nylon seat offers exceptional versatility and maintains its appearance over time
Features a handy hook-and-loop strap to hold the seat in place
Comes in a wide range of attractive colors
Sold with a convenient carrying sack
cons: Chair may tip over on its own
May be too small for some users

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice chair for the price. very lightweight and holds my fat A$$ @ 240 pounds of man beef.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for field research in Costa Rica and I absolutely loved every minute I had it. It was light weight enough that I was able to take it on all of our long hikes into the forest, and it was easy enough that I could have it set up in less than a minute!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Excellent low, lightweight, compact chairs, in cool bags that will clip to your belt to free your hands. Probably not good if you weigh over 250. If you do not order the upgrade with feet, you cannot just add them later. Different design.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy a chair at REI
customer_reviews.text: Many friends have complemented my chair while they sit in their $100 store bought chairs that don’t stack up to this one: comfort, sturdiness, lightweight, packs small, good looking.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J Franks

customer_reviews.title: ... 6 feet tall and 220lbs and sat in this comfortably for 6 hours at a hillclimb the other day
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6 feet tall and 220lbs and sat in this comfortably for 6 hours at a hillclimb the other day. Can't beat how small and light they are.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Suchnick

customer_reviews.title: Decent comfortable lite weight folding chair
customer_reviews.text: Decent comfortable lite weight folding chair. Almost assembles itself because of stretch straps that pull metal rods together. Very intuitive assembly & disassembly. I'm 5'8" and 200 lbs and near the upper limit for this chair. Chair rods bend a bit as I move around but don't break so it has a slight rocking Acton to it. Great for hiking or anytime you have to carry one or more chairs some distance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ultralight chair
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and comfortable. The chair was relatively easy to set up and take down. Wish the manufacturer had supplied a strap with them. We found some luggage straps we had lying around and it made hauling them around during an airshow, a breeze. So, if you don't plan on attaching this to your backpack or something similar, and don't have a strap, about 4ft. in length, I highly recommend that you order one at the time you order this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybird

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service. Light weight chair.
customer_reviews.text: Update, I was contacted by the manufacturer. They stepped up and replaced the chair without question. Sent me a new one free of charge. Ecxellent customer service. Thank you! This chair broke and sent me toppling to the ground. Very flimsy aluminum. And of course this happened 2 months after the warranty had expired. I think I used the chair 5 times before one of the aluminum tubes snapped.
customer_reviews.author: J Hagst

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Chair for Backpacker
customer_reviews.text: An excellent compact lightweight chair. We assembled it in one minute. Make sure the mesh is at the top when assembling. It can support my back and allow me to have a short break in long distance hiking. And I was surprised to found that it was quite strong in 3 days hiking, we will take it with us for more trips, now kids are scrambling for the chair, we decided to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Rebacca

customer_reviews.title: A must for backpackers
customer_reviews.text: For what this chair is, you get an awesome product. Yes, this design has been done better and lighter, but for a lot more money. Very comfortable, definitely beats a log or the ground. I ditched the included bag for it to pack it down smaller, it eats up some space but it isn't terrible. The chair isn't necessarily flimsy, but I wouldn't go out of your way to abuse it. I weigh 160lbs and it holds me no problem. Overall, this chair is awesome for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Ponall

customer_reviews.title: Decent for a cheap backpacking chair
customer_reviews.text: My kids have the helinox zero and those are amazing, so I took a chance on these knowing that they wouldn't quite be as good as the real thing. The weight difference is noticeable but they are still light so this is not a major issue, and they seem sturdy enough. My biggest gripe is that the bottom cushion is more shallow and the seat doesn't sit as low, making them much less comfortable. Still given that the helinox are almost prohibitively expensive, these are certainly worth the trade-offs for a price that makes them worth considering.
customer_reviews.author: Jaykobes

customer_reviews.title: USE THIS CHAIR!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used three times and the rope that holds it together snapped. I have reached out to the company to see how they address this. Overall, it is light, comfortable and compact. My concern here, obviously, is the durability. I will update once (if) I have a solution to this issue. UPDATE:. this company is AMAZING to work with. Sent a replacement ASAP and ensured ny satisfaction with the product. HIGHLY RECOMMEND USING THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory O'Shea

customer_reviews.title: I love how small
customer_reviews.text: I love how small, lightweight, and portable these are. They're perfect for keeping in the back of my van during soccer season. However, they do take a little work to set up, and they are so lightweight that a slight gust of wind blows them right over. Basically, they're great for what we needed them for, but I wouldn't want them for a real camping trip or if I needed to sit for a long time (although for backpacking, they'd be great because of their size and weight).
customer_reviews.author: Momof4Kids

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this chair.
customer_reviews.text: I read a review on a backpacking chair that looked like this one, but it weighed a little less but cost way too much. I was a bit skeptical when I saw this one, but it had nice reviews. After strapping this to my backpack and hiking a couple miles it was so incredibly nice to have a comfy chair. It packs up small and the weight really is pretty light. I tried all the old backpack chairs like the 3 leg version, and folding square. They just aren't worth it. Many rocks are more comfortable than those. This chair is light, compact, and comfortable. The legs are thin, so don't expect to use this in the sand.
customer_reviews.author: D. D.

customer_reviews.title: Also the legs and seat assembly is fine for a stronger adult
customer_reviews.text: It's fair, for the cheaper price my smaller son loves it. However, i really can't see it holding a 200+ person as it claims. Also the legs and seat assembly is fine for a stronger adult, but kids will struggle to get the posts into the chair holes. Overall though, better price than the higher end ones. So if you wanna save a buck, can't go wrong, else spend some more quality. Plus though, it is VERY light with the aluminum poles (didn't weigh it, but I think the 2lb claim is spot on!)
customer_reviews.author: Dark Trainer

customer_reviews.title: Bad posture
customer_reviews.text: It's light, easy to setup, seems study, but the sitting position hurts my back. The angle is too reclined. I'm 170 pounds, six-foot tall and 34 inch waist. The chair fits snug. Being a senior citizen, I need to sit upright or perhaps at a slight recline. The recline in this chair is too much. and it will need to be rebuilt so I can use it. The price of $30.99 is reasonable, but if I add in the time it will take to re-manufacture it so the recline is acceptable, I would have been money ahead buying the $130.00 Big Agnes chair.
customer_reviews.author: DouglasL

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and super easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this chair is it's light weight, and the incredible way it almost assembles itself. The leg pieces look complicated, but they almost fall into place automatically....it's remarkably easy to assemble and take apart. I'm 200 lbs and even though it feels slightly small for my hips I'm happy with this chair. It tends to make me slouch which is not good for my back, but it's fine if I put something behind my back for support. I'm comfortable in it for up to about an hour, but beyond that I'm not. For the price, ease of transport and set up, it's an excellent option for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: alvin

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the more expensive ones!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little chair. I pack it in for backpacking trips and it's so nice to have after a long day. It sets up and breaks down really easily (the first time I set it up, I was worried I'd break something because the chair seat fit so tightly over the poles, but just go slow and be careful and it gets easier each time, nothing to worry about), and packs up fairly small and light. If I was doing a long, many-day trip, I would probably think twice about bringing this, but it is REALLY nice to have
customer_reviews.author: lcsitl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair - compact / lightweight / sturdy - I'm 200 lbs and no issues. Good quality. The only minor detail would be the rubber feet - they come off sometimes in the mud. I'll glue them on. They are too small as well and tend to sink in the soft ground too easily - other than that, this is the best chair I've used. UPDATE: I continue using this chair everywhere - excellent - stong and just a little higher than the Helinox chair so it's easier to get out of ! Highly recommended chair - price is right too. Good storage bag. I'll purchase more chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Markluke

customer_reviews.title: Must be careful
customer_reviews.text: This would be a good camp chair for a younger person, someone that is less than 125 pounds and is careful. I weigh in at over 200 pounds and should be fine if I am careful getting in our out of it. I'll be camping for 10 days in Israel, I doubt it will last. I may bring a backup chair or the camp stool that I have had for over 30 years. My concern is when getting in or out, it rocks. It is not supposed to rock. That is a failure point.
customer_reviews.author: IAmNotSpiderMan

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This chair is not meant for serious lounging, it's meant for compact portability and able to comfortably sit on a chair. The design is great, it's easy to assemble and take apart. I can carry two chairs in my backpack for the wife and I without taking too much room. Great for an art show or event and be able to pull to the side in the shade and chill comfortably. So many possibilities for it's compact design, oh and I was never concerned about holding my 185 weight.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hunting Chair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair for hunting trips into the back country. My back gets pretty sore after sitting/laying on the ground glassing all day. This chair is the perfect remedy for your back. It's very light for a chair, yet sturdy and supportive. I took it up camping last weekend and had several people beat it up sitting in it and leaning back. I'm 220lbs and it handles just fine. No rips, tears, and no creaks or indications it's under too much stress. Great chair!
customer_reviews.author: Peak Freak

customer_reviews.title: Just get it
customer_reviews.text: Great little "chair" that is so compact. I use it for hikes with my 65+ yr old ladies (we like to stop at the top and enjoy some wine), or when we're on the pickleball courts. I rated 'comfort' a little lower just because it is a little confining for guys with wide shoulders like my husband but otherwise, it sustains all 205 lbs of him. Color selection is awesome (Christmas gifts). Delivery was quick. Price was reasonable. I'm buying again.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Biggest disappointment ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a comfortable, light weight, chair for a senior with arthritis. I reviewed and read the stats for this chair over and over, and compared the measurements to chairs I have. 14" from ground to seat was perfect! NOT SO with this chair. It cleared 8 inches maybe. False advertising! I only gave one star to get this review online. Only reason I am not returning is that it is too much trouble, and I have younger people around that can maybe sit in it. Waste of money! This company needs to change the stats. on this chair :(
customer_reviews.author: krb

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair for the price. Compact & easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. Packs nice & small. Easy to set up with all of the poles held together by shock cord. Held a 6'2", 190lb male on a 2-week motorcycle trip without failing. Chair was on uneven and soft terrain and did not bend, break or tear. Advise getting in & out gingerly to avoid a tear at the pockets where the poles insert, breaking the plastic joints, or bending/breaking a pole.
customer_reviews.author: Julie K.

customer_reviews.title: Decent chair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to have at an outdoor music festival. I needed something small and light to store in a backpack for the flight. It met those requirements. It is decent quality and sturdy but...it does sit low to the ground. It makes it difficult to get out of if you're not in ideal physical shape. It is also positions you like an adirondack chair and I don't find those to be comfortable. All in all though, I'm glad I had it as it beat the alternative, trying to sit on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while to do this review. My kid camps a lot with scouts and was in need of this. It's only ok. It was great the first few times he used it and slowly became unsteady. NOt really something that he wants to take with him anymore. I guess we'll have to find a better quality one.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Crazy Large Pups

customer_reviews.title: Was helpful for our trravel needs.
customer_reviews.text: Like the small package to carry this portable sitting chair. fits in the luggage. It even has a cup holder. Used it on Sand and Lawn area worked just find. When first opened had a hard time to put together this device. You should but together at home first to know how to put all the pieces together. We didn't do this and when we tried for the first time. People were looking at us and seeing us have a hard time. Finally, I got it and now no problem. very strong and well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I went camping 2 weeks ago and I used this chair. It is a very good product. I love that it is so compact and so easy to fold and unfold however I wish the legs had some kind of feet to avoid sinking in the dirt. I live in Florida so maybe it's because our ground is so sandy but I had to pull it out of the ground every hour or so. Overall a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christophe

customer_reviews.title: Central Park essential
customer_reviews.text: I was interested in a lightweight chair to carry with me to the park and was really surprised at 1) how comfortable it is and 2) the ease to pop it up and into place. We followed the information pamphlet that was sent with it and put some extra elbow grease in it to stretch out the chair fabric for first time use. We just set it up on our living room to sit in it for a few hours. Since then it works great. Folding the bungees takes some practice but now can pop it out and in into place and fold it back into the bag just fine. I have convinced my NYC friends to buy their own.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline C.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was psyched to get this for an upcoming backpacking trip. The only thing we don't like is the bag it comes in is bulky. So, he's not going to used the bag and just put the chair parts in his backpack. It's a great light-weight chair and fairly sturdy -- I wouldn't get too crazy with it. But after a long day of hiking, it will be way better than sitting on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: N. Easter

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: Just got off a week-long backpacking trip. This chair is light-weight, easy to assemble, and very comfortable. Made it super convenient to use not only at our campsites but on the trail when we took breaks for lunch, etc.. I weigh ~210 pounds and never felt like this chair was at risk of breaking under my weight. The rest of my group all had the REI flexlite chairs. I sat in those and couldn't tell a difference. Why pay triple the price for just the brand name? I'm super happy with this purchase. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for conserving space
customer_reviews.text: I bought my husband this chair to use on his long multi day bike trips. They usually go for several days and camp for the night. Having an actual chair would be a luxury. I gave it a whirl, the chair packs up very small so it is easily strapped to the back of the bike. Not to difficult to set up. My husband is not a big guy (5'10", 175lbs) and its a little wiggly so I think a bigger person might need to be cautious. It may tip but its great to be off the ground after hundreds of miles of driving.
customer_reviews.author: Katie R.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Not Ultralight
customer_reviews.text: I am a backpacker and when I think ultra light, I want sub 2 pound range. However, being that I have long passed my 29th Birthday, I am opting for a little comfort despite a bit of a weight. If you don't mind that trade off, this a great little chair and it held my nearly 200 pounds without complaint, plus it made cooking on the trail that much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Rod

customer_reviews.title: It's a toy
customer_reviews.text: Apparently I missed where it said my @ss would be 6 inches off the ground when sitting in the chair. I returned for a normal sized chair.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Burris

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Luxury
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for backpacking, they were a nice luxury in the wilderness. They're incredibly easy to put together and are fairly light weight. This might sound strange, but they are very flimsy, yet very durable, they have a lot of flex to them when you're not on fairly level ground. Overall we loved them, and I will probably buy a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking chair!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Marchway chair for a backpack camping trip because we really needed chairs that didn’t add too much weight to our load. I actually bought a very light (approx 1lb), way more expensive chair for my husband and this one for myself. For more than a third of the price and a little more weight (approx 2lbs), this little chair is awesome!! Granted it is heavier than the $119 one, but it is so comfortable- my husband actually likes mine bette because it fits his larger body better. You can’t beat the price either — I actually bought 3 additional chairs as gifts to our fellow day hiking friends - they love them too!!
customer_reviews.author: Cary O

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter-in-law to throw in the wagon when she takes my grandson to the neighborhood playground. We were both pleased with the ease of assembly, comfort, and small packed size. I'll be ordering one for myself to take kayak camping and keep in the back of my Jeep for other times I need a chair. I'm 6'0" and 205# and it felt very stable when I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for long hikes
customer_reviews.text: You can throw this in your backpack and hike for miles and barely even notice it. When you get to the middle of nowhere, you have somewhere comfortable to sit. If you are car camping I'd say go for something bigger, but if you have to carry it with you, this chair works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great for camping/backpacking. I have used it on 5 separate trips and it has held up great so far. It works just as well as my buddy’s name-brand chair (both pictured, my green chair next to my buddy’s white name-brand). His cost about 3x as much at REI!
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Worth the comfort...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, but a bit heavier than my 120 dollar chair, which is the rub... spend way more get super light, but no more comfortable...this is not a bad deal! Way better than rocks and logs! One of my weight splurged backpacking! My daughter uses my million dollar chair, and I carry this puppy...
customer_reviews.author: Lief Erickson

customer_reviews.title: very fragile
customer_reviews.text: of course for 2 lbs you can't expect very sturdy but my husband is a slender man and the thing sags. Also it is very close to the ground, and worst of all there is no back support, as it leans way back and even when he reclines it only comes to the center of his spine. Not useful for hunting, better as a child's camp chair.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hodgkins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of lugging my beach chair from the car and across the sand on the beach. This chair is compact, super lightweight and perfect for my needs. I feel comfortable in it. My friend has the same chair and he weighs 190-200 lbs. the chair is sturdy and he has no problems. The only time I felt that it was unsturdy was when my 14 yr old nephew borrowed it and he was leaning back in it and rocking it back on the 2 back legs. It held up fine, but I was watching it closely.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Curland

customer_reviews.title: Good Compact Chair
customer_reviews.text: The chairs are really comfortable, and worth the money. The extra space in our vehicle is insane! Traditional camping chairs take up too much room. These chairs do tip if you are in sand, but other than that, they are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W

customer_reviews.title: Good chair
customer_reviews.text: Great chair. This chair is probably best for small children. I am 5'3", and at times it is difficult to get comfortable on this chair. My small kids on the other hand fit the chairs perfectly. This is easy to assemble, you do have to stretch the fabric a bit to align the poles to the grooves in the fabic.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Get This Chair!
customer_reviews.text: Great chair for the price. If you want to save .5lbs you’d be spending $110. Also, AMAZING customer service. I simply inquired about getting some wider feet for my chair to avoid sinking into mud, and when they discovered my model chair wasn’t compatible with the new feet, they sent me a brand new frame with the wide feet completely free with no shipping charge...
customer_reviews.author: Jackson T

customer_reviews.title: Container Bag Flawed
customer_reviews.text: Container Bag for the chair separated at the seams Bag arrived from the manufacturer with this flaw. Unsure if this can be resolved without returning the entire product. Please advise.
customer_reviews.author: Swanee C Flack

customer_reviews.title: Cute, small chair.
customer_reviews.text: We love this chair mainly for how compact it is. It is also very comfortable. It is sturdy but can at times feel a little unsturdy since it is so light. This would be a great chair to keep in your car for watching your kids games. I really love how compact it is. Also easy to put together and fold into the bag. I felt comfortable in this chair as did my brother who is 200 pounds. If you were bigger then 250 I am not sure how comfortable you might feel.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Small and comfy - great for travel!
customer_reviews.text: We picked up a pair of these for attending MotoGP races in Austin. They were very comfortable over three days of use and packed up small, which was great for motorcycle travel. The only downside is the lack of height adjustment on the legs. When sitting in a sloped surface, you have to get a bit creative!
customer_reviews.author: B. Wipperman

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to put together and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This chair looks so nice and lightweight, but it's too hard to slip the sleeve into the pole. Plus, when I sat on it, half of my thigh is out of the seat. It's not comfortable, feels tight. I think this chair is meant for kids. Updated review: The seller offered to replace the chair at no cost. I received a better chair with higher back which is suited for adults.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This thing works out really well if you need a chair outside. Packs down very small and light. I keep it in my car's trunk for impromptu chill-out sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Steve F.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This chair is super compact and is easy to assemble. Someone said its fine on the beach. I'm assuming they don't know what a beach is. You're going to sink in sand. It is still perfect. A beach towel under the legs and your golden. I'm tall but not really big so its a comfortable fit. I think if you are a bigger person it would feel like your sitting in a baby car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Susan W

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bent leg on third use. I’m 6ft 2in and well under the weight limit. And while it was okay in the comfort department on its third time out the rear leg bent. Very unhappy with the quality of this product after only being used for 4-5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Easy to Put together, Comfortable and a Good Price!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the 14 inch height from the ground for a 90 year old person to get up. I had him try it out...no problem at all. It was sturdy enough...was comfortable on his back and he loved the Orange and Black colors. It was a success all around! I am going to buy another for ME!
customer_reviews.author: Chelyn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these Chairs - Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. Got two of them as an alternative to much pricier options and we do not regret the choice. They are study and durable as any of the alternatives found in outdoor stores. We have the black chairs and they are simple looking and fold easily into the provided bag. Ive been taking them everywhere, hiking, birdwatching, beach, you name it! Happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole de Leon

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: For the size, shape, and weight of this chair, I was really impressed. I've only taken it on day hikes and beach trips for the past couple days, but it's been working great for that. I'll be testing it on a 8 day hike/camp shortly and will update when I know more about the chair's performance. So far, though, I can definitely recommend this. My hiking crew kept stealing it from me and my partner just ordered one for themselves for the 8 day trip.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Eyre

customer_reviews.title: Equal to more expensive brand named.
customer_reviews.text: I backpacked 76 miles with this over 5 nights. It's as light as the expensive rei one my friend had and every bit as sturdy. You can't beat this price/quality combo. I'm very happy with this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Decent chair
customer_reviews.text: Very small and compact to carry. Chair is a nice size and comfortable. Chair does sit low to the ground but I am 5’4 so no issue for me. Con is the connectors are plastic and the chair is not as solid as I would like it to feel.
customer_reviews.author: christina gifford

customer_reviews.title: As good as the expensive models
customer_reviews.text: We use these all the time and have several brands which are pretty generic and similar. Easy to assemble and comfortable and then restore in the carrying case. They seem to get better with each use and are quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr C

customer_reviews.title: Assembles quickly, is more comfy than it looks, and is a good value
customer_reviews.text: I have used this chair several times now, and can assemble it in under 60 seconds. I'm curious how long the fabric will last, but the good news is that the joints and attachment points look sturdy so I'm hoping they will last. The carrying case is convenient and the package is lightweight. I'm hoping to get many years out of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: ADV Rider...  The Marchway camp chair is so Cool to use!  :{)
customer_reviews.text: So i bought this for a 9-day solo 2600 mile motorcycle trip i went on and man did the little chair work great. I am 6'6" and 230lbs and found the Marchway folding chair a perfect fit. I packed small and was easy to carry on the bike. It was easy/fast to assemble and use. It was part of the talk of the campfire everywhere i stopped. Many people commented on it asking where to get one! Thanks for a great product! :{)
customer_reviews.author: Mike O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for a husky fella
customer_reviews.text: As I was putting it together (sliding the poles into place) I had my doubts. I sat down as slowly as possible, figuring it was going to snap under my weight. I was pleasantly surprised when it held up under my 220 lbs. I don’t know how long it will last but after 10 uses I have had no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: B.P.

customer_reviews.title: Well designed easy to use chair
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chair to lighten the load of my current setup. This chair is extremely light and has put up with below freezing temps and rough conditions. The legs dig into the ground sometimes unevenly. It’s comfortable for me but I am a smaller person. I have no regrets buying this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Really well made
customer_reviews.text: I have only put it together and sat in it a couple of times. My initial observations are that it is really well made and thought out. It is very compact, lightweight and easy to assemble. It is impressive especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: James Barstow

customer_reviews.title: It's as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some reviewers, I had no problem putting it together. At 76 years old, I had plenty of strength to pull over the final rod. I am 5'6 and 135 pounds. It feels stable. It is the exact height for me. Not too high (as I sometimes bring my chair into my snug tent when it's raining. Not too low that I cannot bend knees in comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Furman

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but a bit not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very comfortable, has a great support and it's easy to pack. My only comment is that when I used it in camping I had to make sure I place it somewhere firm or else it wasn't stable enough. But overall very happy and will probably buy more of it.
customer_reviews.author: Siavash

customer_reviews.title: very easy to tip over
customer_reviews.text: Chair not very balanced, very easy to tip over, not kid friendly at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tuan

customer_reviews.title: You will throw away your old camping chair.
customer_reviews.text: You will throw away your old camping chair for sure. #1 space saver. #2 light. #3 price is right. #4 <insert your personal reason here> Solid build. Great price. Very easy to put together and it packs very well back into the case.
customer_reviews.author: Leon O.

customer_reviews.title: Sits very low
customer_reviews.text: I question the sturdiness of this chair as the tubes are pretty narrow and lightweight. It holds my husband (195 lbs.) but he struggles to get up as it sits very low to the ground. Once seated he is unable to move around much for fear of tipping sideways.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great compact chair to keep in the vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are great for our family camping trips. They pack down small and store easily. Setup is fairly quick. The only problem I see with it is the feet will sink in soft ground and the chair is fairly low to the ground but that’s just a trade off for it’s compact size I suppose. Otherwise I’m pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: D Haught

customer_reviews.title: Too much work for a rickety chair
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning this. As a petite woman, the size fit me perfectly and I have no doubt it can hold the weight it claims but it is easy to tip over. I was looking for something to just fold out at my kids soccer games but I guess I missed the part where you have to assemble and disassemble it with every use. Disassembling is fine, however assembling it takes at least 5 minutes and in my opinion is not worth $30.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very nice portable chairs. I'm small so it was comfortable for me. I asked my boyfriend to sit in it and he liked it, but I think he would prefer a bigger chair. It is sturdy and good quality. I love how small and light it is.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Belle

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in a portable infrared sauna. It's much more comfortable than a typical outdoor folding chair, and the angle is great for kicking back and relaxing. It might be a little low to the ground for taller people, so just check the dimensions before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my bf and he loved it. My landlord lady sat and spent 40 minutes and didn’t want to stand up again. The only con is the weight capacity, I’m over 240 lbs so I cannot have this wonderful product... that’s why I give a 4
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Frias

customer_reviews.title: Low and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Definitely lightweight and compact carry..but if you like low to the ground sitting it's good for that..or for kids no taller than 4.5 ft for comfort..can lean back to take pressure off your legs that's a plus
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This fits in my 40L bag and is compact, easy to set up, and comfortable. Good product. I bought two and have used only 1. On muddy ground the small legs can dig in; but was still stable. The second I used once and it tore at the corner; but Gorilla Glue seems to have fixed it. For the price and size these can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this compact yet comfortable chair
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a new camping/lawn chair, and was intrigued by this design. Was not disappointed. I love how compact and lightweight it is. But I also really appreciate the comfort of the chair for chilling outside for a couple hours. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Butler

customer_reviews.title: This is great for a small adult or a child under 150 pounds.
customer_reviews.text: The construction of the chair was better than expected. This is great for a small adult or a child under 140 pounds. You must be sitting on a solid surface. The legs will sink in sand, loose dirt, or gravel.
customer_reviews.author: Carleton L. Swafford

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and small chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great, just wish it was a bit easier to put on the fabric part over the metal structure. Small, lightweight, always in our trunk of a car for all the outdoor adventures. Would recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Yana Rodin-Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Need Longer Legs
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this chair is easy to assemble and has a carrying case to walk around with, but it is very low to ground and sometimes hard to stand up. My friends all liked how fast I put it together, but when I sat down their facial expressions changed. The next thing I heard is Try and Stand up....LOL!!
customer_reviews.author: P. DAVIE

customer_reviews.title: For Kids Only
customer_reviews.text: MUCH smaller than expected. I wouldn’t trust this to hold an adult. We are going to let one of our kids use this one. It definitely seems like it’s for a child.
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Took on a trip to the boundary waters. It does the job. I am 6'1 195lbs and I didn't have any issues. Only thing I took a star off for was the comfortability. It was fine, but I did sit in some of my other friends chairs and the shoulder/ back support seemed to be higher up on their chairs which I thought was more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Danielson

customer_reviews.title: Must have luxury
customer_reviews.text: I love how small it is and I would say its as sturdy as I would expect. I'm just careful when getting in and out of the chair. And I alway makesure my weight is evenly distributed. Its nice to have something to lean back on and relax. Much better than sitting on a stump and or rock. Its definitely worth the little weight it is.
customer_reviews.author: Taft A Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with this product. It is little bit smaller and it result to not comfortable some what but It is good for carrying out to out door.
customer_reviews.author: kimsuamu

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great size and very light weight. Just under 2 pounds. I’m 5.5 165 pounds athletic build and sit in this very comfortably. My son is 6.’3” 180 pounds and also likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Queen B

customer_reviews.title: Super durable / comfortable / well-engineered
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a few times, and was easy to put together from the first camp-out. Seem really well-built. Goes back into storage bag easily. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Prince

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry Compact chair , easy to clean, easy to setup. Holds me well at 173lbs with utmost confidence....even on a slight plane. Dig the camo design too. Can't go wrong with camo.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great for price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair! it is small and light weight. It is a little larger than an umbrella. The first time setting it up I needed help to stretch out the cover - but now I can get it on myself. It is a little rickety when sitting in it but if you have stable ground its great! It is perfect for the price. Way cheaper than the REI brand and pretty much does the same thing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, good quality, bargain buy
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever wanted to take a chair to an event but didn’t feel like lugging a chair around, well this solves that problem. These chairs are super lightweight and portable. They fit into a backpack and when you need to use it just open it up and wala you have yourself a chair. Assembly is a breeze with the tent style poles. When compared to REI brand similar chair these are a great buy and bang for your buck. Don’t pass these by.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Parks

customer_reviews.title: Updated!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The seller was super helpful and sent me an upgrade at no charge. The upgrade is exactly what I needed! SUPER service and follow up! Highly recommend! ORIGINAL COMPLAINT: Too small and low to the ground for the average human (and I'm 5'4" so no giant). There is no real seat, just fabric, causing a person to be pitched backward instead of a sitting position. Miserable. Left it in the hotel.
customer_reviews.author: Angela McCalla

customer_reviews.title: Handy little chairs
customer_reviews.text: We are avid backpackers, although these particular chairs don’t fold down as small and light as the ones we put in our pack, they are awesome for keeping in the cars! They are sturdy and the same quality as more expensive ones. They take up minimal space in the car and are great to pull out anytime you stop or don’t want to tote along a bulky chair (concerts, fireworks, bbq’s, day at the lake)
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: It is small but can hold 6'2"/220 lb adult
customer_reviews.text: The chair went with me on a beach and to a campground. Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this chair!
customer_reviews.text: I am a solid 250 pounds and have enjoyed this chair on backpacking trips and will be using it on a cross country bicycle tour in the fall. I take it to all of my daughter's marching band dates so that I have a chair to sit on while we are waiting. If you are okay with sacrificing a few ounces. Save your money and buy this chair!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Grace

customer_reviews.title: Light, comfortable, a hassle to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is lightweight, comfortable enough, and it packs down to a small size. But it's a hassle to set up and take down--you can't fold it without taking the cover off.
customer_reviews.author: Tiva

customer_reviews.title: Installing the last fabric corner
customer_reviews.text: The chair is true to its advertisement, light weight, sturdy, and comfortable. The only difficult part of assembly is inserting the last fabric corner onto the pole, need a lot of strength. I found it a little easier to take that last pole out of the frame, insert the corner of the material, that gives you more leverage, then insert the pole into the frame, does take a lot of strength.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Portable, easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quick and it light and portable to put in back bag, motorcycle saddle bags or vehicle for those unexpected trips to parks, beaches and piers.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Great chair. I have the expensive kind and this one, while heavier, is more comfortable and about 1/3 the price. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Samson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this at all. Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Chair doesn’t support any normal human being weight and breaks easy. Customer service is a joke. Buy from somebody else
customer_reviews.author: Deven

customer_reviews.title: compact and super portable!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is perfect for my needs. Easy to assemble and repack. Level surface is ideal for placement, of course, but the seat is comfortable and roomy enough for a medium sized adult.
customer_reviews.author: Debrief

customer_reviews.title: This was a good choice.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is compact and withheld use by a 16 year old boy who weighs over 170 pounds for a seven day camping trip in the wilderness with a group of 10 other boys. He was very glad we splurged on this so he could sit comfortably around the campfire at night after a long day of canoeing and porting. It is a small, lightweight package when disassembled and perfect for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

product_meta.title: MARCHWAY Ultralight Folding Camping Chair, Portable Compact for Outdoor Camp, Travel, Beach, Picnic, Festival, Hiking, Lightweight Backpacking
feature_bullets: Ultra Light and Compact: Weighs only 2 pounds that can be picked up with a finger, and folds down to a 14.20 x 5.20 inch stuff sack that can fit into a carry-on.

Simple Setup: Foldable aluminum pole with shock-cord structure enables quick set up and fold down. Within one minute you can finish the assembly process. Velcro strap can hold the frame together easily.
Super Comfort: Ergonomic seat design gives you optimal seat experience. Breathable seat net brings you comfort when in hot season.

Heavy Duty and Durable: Ripstop nylon seat + aircraft-grade corrosion-resistant aluminum alloy frame provides load capacity up to 250 pounds. 4 corners at the back of seat fabric are greatly reinforced to ensure reliability.

Versatility: Ideal for tailgating, mountaineering, motorcycling, hunting, music festival, concert party, park, BBQ, road trip, adventuring and anyone looking for light travel without the bulk. A decent Holiday Gift for families and friends.
